data.title: Great food and beer menu
data.text: Food is excellent.  Very good service.  Locally owned business, would highly recommend.  Beer menu is unbelievable.  Too many choices, would like to try them all.

data.title: Neat little Irish pub
data.text: We liked the dark pub look of the place and selection off beverage.  Loved the hilarious menu descriptions.  Our sandwiches were just average though.  The penultimate grilled cheese sounded way better than it was - two types of cheese, fried cheese curds but then cold cheez whiz detracted.  Our side salads of cucumber and a spicy slaw was not that tasty.

data.title: The place I recommend -- awesome atmosphere, great menu, not the norm!
data.text: Whether it's recommending a place to business associates from out of town or heading there myself, Toad Hall has become a favorite of mine.  With its unique English pub atmosphere, awesome blends of music, spacious bar area, cozy dark-wood booth spaces and incredible menu selections, it's a gem in town.  If you stop in, know that the booths are reserved for food, so if you're just having drinks, snag a place at the long bar with comfy stools and easy views of the TVs (not to mention friendly bartenders!).  Typically this isn't a 'fast' place, but a place to unwind, slow down and enjoy your food and drinks, maybe even a game of Checkers or Trivia before dinner arrives with the games stored on shelves above the booths.  They make a great Brandy Old-Fashioned Sweet, and for dinner - their burgers are fantastic -- try the N.W.A. or the Breakfast Burger.  For out of this world mac-and-cheese, you can't go wrong with their's -- it's got four different types of cheese, is heavy, intense and delightful - and you'll probably be taking some home with you.  This isn't a standard bar, and that's why I love it.  Trivia Night on Thursdays gets very loud and crowded with limited seating/standing room, so try a different night if you're going for a more quiet dinner / social drinks.  Geared towards adults, it's a cool place to hang out.

data.title: A Pleasant Surprise
data.text: My husband and I were intrigued by the name Toad Hall, so we stopped in for dinner one Saturday night when we happened to be in Racine. We enjoyed our visit very much. Toad Hall is suggestive of an old English pub, with lots of dark wood and tankards hanging over the bar, so in regard to atmosphere it deserves a big thumbs up. What really stood out, however, was the food. I ordered the "Firehouse Meatloaf" because it sounded so tasty, and it was. It came with  sweet/tangy barbecue glaze that complemented the meat perfectly, which was not dry (a common problem with meatloaf) or so moist that it was a mushy mess. For sides I had brown sugar carrots and mashed potatoes. I'm not big on cooked carrots, but these were delicious, with just enough brown sugar to bring out their natural sweetness. What I dislike about cooked carrots is that they're tricky where their consistency is concerned; too often they're either so hard that they fight back or a wet mess, but these were cooked quite well. The mashed potatoes were creamy. My husband's biscuit-topped pot pie could have used a bit more seasoning, but he added pepper and was pleased with his meal.  We're not in Racine very often, but when were are and we're hungry Toad Hall will get our business.

data.title: Good food and beer, slow service
data.text: Good, no, excellent selection of beer. Surprisingly large menu and great food combinations. Dark English pub environment. Friendly locals.

data.title: Great Food....Beers Galore
data.text: Great food, beers galore....staff is slow, so dont expect to run into eat and leave.  The cucumber salad is super, especially during the cold winter months, makes you think of summer picnic.

data.title: GET the meatloaf!
data.text: Old irish beer bar feel with GREAT food. Everthing on menu is awesome but get the meatloaf first. Wide variety of beers, friendly staff, nice location.

data.title: Good food, slow service
data.text: Toad hall is a great place to go if you want good food and are not in any hurry. I have been here for lunch three times now and have always been happy with the taste and quality of my food. The burgers and sandwiches are very good and the tater tots are simply amazing. However, this is not the place to eat if you want to be in and out in less than an hour as there is only one person working both the bar and dining area.

data.title: Underwhelming
data.text: Went here on multiple occasions. Supposed to be a cool atmosphere with good drinks and great food. I don't see it. I know people who swear by this place but they must be related or something. No atmosphere the 3x I've been there and the food was just ok. I don't get it. Maybe I'm just going on bad days. I'll never know though, because I won't be going back

data.title: Come for trivia, stay for the food
data.text:
I have to say that I am a little biased towards Toad Hall, since I haven't actually paid to eat there in quite a while. They have trivia on Thursday nights, and I win on a fairly regular basis, enough that I can eat on the house with my trivia winnings.
Toad Hall has exceptional food for a bar. Their burgers are excellent, with a wide variety of toppings. They also have amazing mac and cheese, as noted in several other reviews. They have terrific salads, either the chopped salad or the Mexican salad.
If you are a fan of beer, you will love Toad Hall. They have a very large selection of beers, enough that  they have a "100 beers" club you can join.

data.title: Awesome Mac & Cheese
data.text: We've gone here for breakfast and lunch.  I am not too fond of the breakfast, I mean it was good but just not thrilled.  You only get one piece of toast and it's not buttered, but oh well, the lunch makes up for it!  I recommend you try the mac & cheese with bacon - yummy!  The burgers are very good too.  I am NOT a tater tot person, my husband it, but the loaded tater tots are pretty darn good!  Bloody Mary - no unless you like the Zing Zang or whatever that is - I do not like that mix.  We've also tried the cajun chicken on a pita - very good and the cucumber salad is tasty.  The music is fun.  We will go back again for lunch.  Nice on a Saturday afternoon - not too busy.

data.title: Best Onion Rings!
data.text: I always ask if the onion rings are homemade.... they always say "YES"... well, these actually are!  They were the BEST!  I took one home and it was crunchy 4 hours later!!!  Then there was the burger - AWESOME!  the Istambul Burger - topped with tapenade and stuffed with feta - just the right amount to make all the flavors work together.  Went back a week later... just as good.  Had the Rings again.  Had the bruschetta - just a bit too much balsamic for me but that's me.  Then we split the Mozarella, Avocado, Bacon burger with hand cut fries - SO GOOD!  Oh, and they have tons of imported beers and they are not skunky at all!!  I would highly recommend.

data.title: Great Pub, Great Food
data.text: If you think this place is just a pub, you have been missing out on the best food to go with your drinks.  Start out with the wings and then try any of the burgers.  These are the best wings in Racine, and the chefs have mastered the art of "medium rare".

data.title: pub + burgen
data.text: un pub al estilo ingles, con una excelente atencion y un buen ambiente; las hamburguesas son exquisitas.  Los jueves por la noche se organiza una trivia donde juegan todos los que estan en el bar, es muy divertido!
